No, there's too many damn cheaters and STEAM doesn't seem to care,!
If it wasn't for FACEIT and ESEA people would not be able to play this game and strive to get better when they get matched with cheaters against whom not even professional players would stand a fighting chance, while playing solo. There are blantant cheaters that boost others that completly ruin the game experience, its is literally impossible to play against cheaters but its not impossible to find them and ban them, FACEIT  and ESEA servers prove that it is possible to filter almost 99% of hackers with updated anti-cheat software, OW was instored but its very uneffective, when your own teammates report for hacking there should be a special consideration from OW and those cases should be reviewed, when i'm matched with cheaters, i will try to kick them, i will troll them , i will kill them , because cheaters are the enemy. Cheaters destroy the game experience and cast doubt against high skill players, and this game is something i've played since 1.6 and its a great experience when there are no cheaters. Althought until STEAM wakes up and decides to show their comunnity they care there is no point in playing this game

CS:GO is a great game to play if your into competitive fps. Its very team based. But on the down side you can get banned easily for long periods of time. Like banning to many people can ban you for a week, or people banning you as a "Joke" can get you up to a week ban
